etymology.description: 𫻺 (original form) -> 虎(虎) (hǔ, "tiger") + 戈(戈) (gē, "weapon") = violence -> 㬥 derived (日(日), 共共) = sun exposure -> rice 米 added, plant stylized -> stylized 水 (unrelated) -> final form 暴
etymology.interpretation: The character 暴 originated from the combination of 虎(虎) (hǔ, "tiger") and 戈(戈) (gē, "weapon"), symbolizing violence. However, it was later represented phonetically by 㬥 (日(日), 共共), indicating exposure to the sun with hands lifting a plant. The addition of 米 (mǐ, "rice") emphasized sun-drying, and ultimately, the character evolved to 暴, losing visible plant elements. The character retains meanings related to exposure and violence.

examples.chinese: 他以暴制暴(他以暴制暴)。
在示威游行中(在示威遊行中)，警方遭遇到了暴力抗议(警方遭遇到了暴力抗議)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shìwēi yóuxíng zhōng, jǐngfāng zāoyù dàole bàolì kàngyì.
examples.english: During the protest march, the police encountered violent demonstrations.

examples.chinese: 这部电影揭示了历史上的暴行真相(這部電影揭示了歷史上的暴行真相)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng jiēshìle lìshǐ shàng de bàoxíng zhēnxiàng.
examples.english: This movie reveals the truth behind historical atrocities.
